name: Jimmy White's 2: Cueball
description:
Jimmy White's 2: Cueball is a sports simulation video game published by Virgin Interactive as a sequel to Jimmy White's 'Whirlwind' Snooker. It was originally released in 1999 for Windows exclusively in Europe, and later on that year for the Dreamcast, also exclusive to Europe. A PlayStation version was later released in March 2000 in Europe and then in November 2000 in North America, distributed and released by BAM! Entertainment. The development team was led by Archer MacLean, the designer of the original game. Cueball is a highly realistic snooker and pool simulator. The game also includes many other mini games; that are connected with a bar room setting.

A sequel to Cueball, Jimmy White's Cueball World, was released exclusively in Europe for the PC in 2001.
